channel.title: Which CANbus avail at OBD2 connector 2009 Honda
channel.description:
I want to receive/transmit lock and unlock codes to my 2009 Honda Accord.
I have plugged into the CANbus at the OBD2 connector and am successfully reading CAN frames. However, I'm not capturing any lock/lock codes.
I read [on this post](https://carloop.dyndns.org/t/honda-b-can-and-carloop/152) that there are 2 CAN busses on the Honda's, bridged through a gateway module. SO my questions are:
1. Which CAN bus (F or B) am I connecting to at the OBD2 connector? Since my speed is 500k on the bus I assume F. 2. How can I ask the gateway to bridge lock codes (send and receive) across the busses? 3. If #2 is not possible, how can I (easily) connect to the CAN-B on this car? I say in the other post that an Odysey owner jumpered into CAN-B at a car heater module...but hoping for something easier or under-dash.

item.title: Which CANbus avail at OBD2 connector 2009 Honda
item.dc:creator: ohseegee
item.description:
I want to receive/transmit lock and unlock codes to my 2009 Honda Accord.

I have plugged into the CANbus at the OBD2 connector and am successfully reading CAN frames. However, I’m not capturing any lock/lock codes.

I read on this post that there are 2 CAN busses on the Honda’s, bridged through a gateway module. SO my questions are:

  1. Which CAN bus (F or B) am I connecting to at the OBD2 connector? Since my speed is 500k on the bus I assume F.
  2. How can I ask the gateway to bridge lock codes (send and receive) across the busses?
  3. If #2 is not possible, how can I (easily) connect to the CAN-B on this car? I say in the other post that an Odysey owner jumpered into CAN-B at a car heater module…but hoping for something easier or under-dash.

Read full topic
